result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen R Scarver

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Witness fee request prepared for Abraham C. was DENIED by the DAs Victim/Witness Services because the witness was not ordered to appear, witness appeared voluntarily.
Witness fee request prepared for Abraham, C. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.
JusticePoint Discharge Summary received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Richard Henry Hart in court.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for a sentencing hearing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Abraham C. and Debra G., 4065 N Sherman Blvd, Milwaukee, WI (All residences, residents, grounds, parking lots, etc.)

Defendant Allen R Scarver in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   Any restitution will be determined at sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine filed.
filed.
State's Requested Jury Instructions filed.

Defendant Allen R Scarver in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for final pretrial conference.  The state requests case be adjourned.  Defense counsel does not object and informs the court case may resolve.  The Court grants state's request.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Jury trial previously scheduled is removed.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Allen R Scarver in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests jury trial.   Case is adjourned for  final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 26.  
Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
filed.

Defendant Allen R Scarver in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel received an offer and needs additional discovery.  Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant's Preliminary Pretrial Motions and Motions in Limine filed.

Defendant Allen R Scarver in court with attorney Richard Henry Hart.  Ronald Dague for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Report dated 6/1/15.

15RM026761  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/28/15

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Abraham C; Debra G;  4065 N Sherman Blvd (All residences, residents, grounds, parking lots etc).
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Allen R Scarver in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Allen R Scarver in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he  may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
